name: Loerlein Unemployment Compensation Case. Duquesne Brewing Company of Pittsburgh v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant; Pittsburgh Brewing Company v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Duquesne Brewing Co. v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review

judges: Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
parties: Loerlein Unemployment Compensation Case. Duquesne Brewing Company of Pittsburgh v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant. Pittsburgh Brewing Company v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The judgment of the Superior Court is affirmed on the opinion of Judge Hirt.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

Mead J. Mulvihill, with him Robert J. Grier, 2nd, L. P. Monahan, Clyde H. Slease and Mulvihill, Colimar, Herron & Grier, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Loerlein Unemployment Compensation Case. Duquesne Brewing Company of Pittsburgh v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant. Pittsburgh Brewing Company v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant.
Argued May 24, 1948.
Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
July 6, 1948:
Richard H. Wagner, with him William L. Hammond, Special Deputy Attorney General and T. McEeen Ghidsey, Attorney General, for appellant.
Mead J. Mulvihill, with him Robert J. Grier, 2nd, L. P. Monahan, Clyde H. Slease and Mulvihill, Colimar, Herron & Grier, for appellees.
